decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play powerful cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, Pyrogoyf, and Sundering Eruption. By using fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and City of Traitors, along with cards like Simian Spirit Guide, the deck can flood the board with threatening creatures and powerful spells early in the game. Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon also disrupt opponent's mana bases, while cards like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury provide additional damage to close out the game quickly. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom along with Nomads en-Kor and Springheart Nantuko to generate an infinite loop of card draws and creature buffs. The deck includes various mana ramp cards like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to quickly get the necessary resources for the combo. Additionally, cards like Gaea's Cradle and Green Sun's Zenith help in tutoring necessary pieces. The sideboard includes cards like Collector Ouphe and Sylvan Safekeeper to deal with different matchups and potential threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures alongside disruptive spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while clocking them with efficient beaters. With a mix of removal, disruption, and card advantage, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value and flexibility to the deck's game plan. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive game plan while providing the necessary colors for the deck's spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, and then using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful early game advantage. Additionally, it utilizes disruptive cards like Wasteland, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will to control the opponent's resources and protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient reanimation of powerful creatures while also disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom in combination with Nomads en-Kor to generate infinite card draw and mana, allowing for a game-winning sequence. The deck includes various control elements such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Green Sun's Zenith to provide flexibility and consistency in executing the combo. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy while also providing access to necessary colors for casting spells effectively.

This control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It also aims to generate card advantage and value through card draw with Ponder and Brainstorm, as well as with creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional forms of interaction and card advantage. The deck is well-rounded with a mix of countermagic, removal, and card advantage engines, allowing it to adapt to different matchups and control the flow of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, as well as disruption from Chalice of the Void, Thought-Knot Seer, and Glaring Fleshraker, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early in the game. With powerful finishers like It That Heralds the End and Sowing Mycospawn, this Eldrazi Aggro deck looks to close out games quickly and decisively before the opponent can fully establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a low cost. The deck also includes powerful disruption and control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck aims to win the game quickly through powerful reanimated threats.
